name: Hindu Gods and Goddesses
description: A brief description about Hindu Gods and Goddesses

God.val: First member of the Hindu Trinity and is " the Creator" because he periodically creates everything in the universe
Second member of the Hindu Trinity. He maintains the order and harmony of the universe
Third member of the Hindu Trinity, tasked with destroying the universe in order to prepare for its renewal at the end of each cycle of time
One of the most beloved Hindu gods and hero of the Ramayana
If one Hindu god’s name is known and recognized throughout the world, it is Krishna

God (continued).key: Indra, the King of Heaven and lord of the gods
God (continued).val: Wields a thunderbolt and is a protector and provider of rain.
A golden warrior arriving on a chariot pulled by seven white horses
Holds a special place in Hindu fire ritual to this day as the sacrificer

God (continued).key: Hanuman, the monkey king and devoted servant
God (continued).val: Featured in the great Hindu epic the Ramayana as a servant of Rama

Goddess.val: Consort of Brahma the Creator and is worshipped as the goddess of learning, wisdom, speech, and music
Goddess of good fortune, wealth, and well-being
Powerful, even frightening goddess who fights fiercely in order to restore dharma (moral order)
Hindu goddess of love, fertility and devotion
